Docs.summary: The exception that is thrown when a is in an invalid <xref:System.Threading.Thread.ThreadState%2A> for the method call.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Once a thread is created, it is in at least one of the <xref:System.Threading.ThreadState> states until it terminates. `ThreadStateException` is thrown by methods that cannot perform the requested operation due to the current state of a thread. For example, trying to restart an aborted thread by calling <xref:System.Threading.Thread.Start%2A> on a thread that has terminated throws a ThreadStateException.
ThreadStateException uses the HRESULT COR_E_THREADSTATE, which has the value 0x80131520.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of ThreadStateException, see the <xref:System.Threading.ThreadStateException.%23ctor%2A> constructors.
## Examples The following example demonstrates an error that causes the system to throw a `ThreadStateException`.
[!code-cpp[ThreadStEx#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.threading.threa_3_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[ThreadStEx#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.threading.threa_3_1.vb)] [!code-cs[ThreadStEx#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.threading.threa_3_1.cs)]
This code produces the following output:
``` In main. Attempting to restart myThread. Working thread... Caught: Thread is running or terminated. Cannot restart. ```

## Remarks An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception should include a reference to the previous exception in the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property. The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor, or `null` if the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Threading.ThreadStateException>.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|The inner exception reference.| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|The error message string.|
